Description: Limestone stela, rectangular, carved in relief with two subjects separated by an inscription and surrounded by a double border of vine-scrolls and guilloche, on the upper half, a cross patée with loop on the upper limb, between two twisted columns with foliated capitals; on the lower half, a dove or eagle standing above a branch with its wings raised above its head enclosing a medallion containing a cross, round its neck is a pendant disc, and beneath its beak a small cross, an inscription of four lines between the two areas of decoration shows that the stone is in memory of Sophrone.
Bibliographic references: Wessel 1963 / Koptische Kunst: die Spätantike in Ägypten (p.114-117 with fig. 85) (provenance given as "Edfu(?)")
Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (942)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.239)
Exhibition history: 2015 1 April - 15 Sept. Berlin, Bode Museum, 'EIN GOTT - Abrahams Erben am Nil'
